{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3525538,"name":"IBOTS 2370","username":"IBOTS","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ibots/{size}/240421_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T01:14:49.172Z","cooked":"

We are working on our swerve code and running into some problems with our code this year. Occasionally upon start up the wheels will rotate around 360 degrees and then stop. They’ll work as intended afterward but all are slightly off position. We assume this may have to do with the optimize function that we are using or an issue with sending negative values to our rotation motors. However upon trying to address these issues we have not been able to find a solution. We have added a custom optimize function but it doesn’t appear to allow the wheels to spin continuously fully though 360 degrees of movement - instead the wheels will rotate 180 then snap back to the zero position and continue in a circle rather than move smoothly and completely through all 360 degrees.

We are using krakens and Team 364’s optimize function from their 2023 code

Here is a link to our code on GitHub: GitHub - FRCTeam2370/2025BaseSwerveCode: This is all of the working functional Swerve Code that should be used as a base for all robots this year.

Any help would be much appreciated. Many thanks!
